MConf::CStconfig

CStconfig Class Reference

Magnetic configuration of a stellarator. More...

#include <CStconfig.h>

bool loadTokamak (const CStconfig *mconf)
 The method creates the circular tokamak with the same R0, a, and iota as in the mconf.

Surface quantity
double r (double s) const
 The method returns the effective radius r=a*sqrt(s), where a is the plasma minor radius defined as sqrt(averageCrossSectionArea(s=1)/pi), this definition of a is used by VMEC code.
double rdkes (double s) const
 The method returns the effective radius defined as sqrt(Flux(s)/B00(s)/pi).
double rdkes2 (double s)
double rgraz (double s)
 The method returns the minor radius dr=ds/<|grad(s)|> (Graz definition of the radius ).
double drgraz_dr (double s)
 The method returns dr_graz/dr, where r=a*sqrt(s) is the VMEC definition of minor radius.
double drdkes_dr (double s)
 The method returns dr_dkes/dr, where r=a*sqrt(s) is the VMEC definition of minor radius.
double drdkes2_dr (double s)
double epsEffGraz (double s)
 The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport, using Graz definition of the minor radius dr=ds/<|grad(s)|>, where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double epsEffDkes (double s)
 The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport, using DKES definition of minor radius r=sqrt(Flux(s)/(pi*B_00(s))), where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double epsEffVmec (double s)
 The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport, using VMEC definition of minor radius r=a*sqrt(s), where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double epsEffNorm (double s)
 The method returns the normalized effective helical ripple for transport, using normalized diffusion coefficient.
double epsEffHat (double s)
 The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport, using definition (2), (5) in http://epsppd.epfl.ch/Madeira/html/pdf/P5.055.pdf , 28th EPS, EGA Vol.25A (2001) 1985-1988.
double Gw (double s)
 eq(21) in Physics of Plasmas 12,112507(2005), http://link.aip.org/link/doi/10.1063/1.2131848
double Gs (double s)
 eq(26) in Physics of Plasmas 12,112507(2005), http://link.aip.org/link/doi/10.1063/1.2131848
double Gv (double s)
 The methods return the bounce-averade gradB drift velocity of trapped particles averaged over flux surface.
void epsEffSetXeffParam (double xmin=.05, double xmax=.95, int size=51)
 The method sets parameters for calculating eps_eff and Gw, Gs, Gv.

 The method sets parameters for calculating the eps_eff and Gw, Gs, Gv.

 The method sets parameters for calculating the eps_eff and Gw, Gs, Gv.

 The method sets parameters for calculating the eps_eff and Gw, Gs, Gv.

 The method calculates and stores the eps_eff in the look-up table.

 The method clears the look-up table with the bootstrap current geometric factors.
double FbsVmec (double s)
 The method returns the bootstrap current geometric factor for transport, using VMEC definition of minor radius r=a*sqrt(s), where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double FbsDkes (double s)
 The method returns the bootstrap current geometric factor for transport, using DKES definition of minor radius r=sqrt(Flux(s)/(pi*B_00(s))), where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double FbsGraz (double s)
 The method returns the bootstrap current geometric factor for transport, using Graz definition of the minor radius dr=ds/<|grad(s)|>, where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double GrazLambdab (double s)
 The method returns the bootstrap current geometric factor for transport, using Graz definition of the minor radius dr=ds/<|grad(s)|>, where s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double FbsFtrap (double s)
double Fbsg2Vmec (double s)
double Fbsg2Dkes (double s)
double Fbsg2Graz (double s)
double Fbsg2 (double s)
 The method returns flux surface average of g2, where g2 is defined as B*grad(g2/B^2) = B x grad(s) * grad(1/B^2), s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double Fbsu (double s)
 The method returns flux surface average of u, where u is defined as B*grad(u) = -B x grad(s) * grad(1/B^2), s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double FbsuB2 (double s)
 The method returns flux surface average of u*B^2, where u is defined as B*grad(u) = -B x grad(s) * grad(1/B^2), s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double Fbsu2B2 (double s)
 The method returns flux surface average of u^2*B^2, where u is defined as B*grad(u) = -B x grad(s) * grad(1/B^2), s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double FbsB2 (double s)
 The method returns flux surface average of B^2.
double Fbsg4 (double s, double mu)
 The method returns flux surface average of g4, where g4 is defined as B*grad(g4/xi) = B x grad(s) * grad(1/xi) and xi = sqrt(1 - mu*B/Bmax), s is the normalized toroidal flux.
double Fbsg4Vmec (double s, double mu)
Vector3d omega_d_BounceAveraged (const Vector3d &mag0, double dphi=0.00698, int iotaDenominator=0)
 The method returns bounce average of according formula for elecrons, where , , , is the curvature vector.
std::vector< double > Jinvariant (const Vector3d &mag, double dphi=0.00698, int iotaDenominator=0)
 The method returns the parallel adiabatic invariant with the integral taken between two turning points according formula .
std::vector< double > Jinv_omega_d_BounceAveraged (const Vector3d &mag0, double dphi=0.00698, int iotaDenominator=0)
 The method returns bounce average of ( see omega_d_BounceAveraged() ) and the parallel adiabatic invariant with the integral taken between two turning points according formula (see Jinvariant()).

Detailed Description

Magnetic configuration of a stellarator.

Class for geometric calculation. This class provides the coordinate transformation between magnetic coordinates and real space coordinates.

Usage:
 #include "CStconfig.h"
 int main() {
   CStconfig mConf;
   mConf.load ("w7x-sc1.bin4"); //load configuration with Boozer coordinates
   if(!mConf.isOK()) exit(1);   //exit with error
   mConf.truncate(1e-5);        //truncate spectrum
   mConf.setAccuracy(epsA);     //set accuracy of transformation
   mConf.setB0(2.5);            //set minimum value of B on magn. axis

   Vector3d cyl(6,0.01745,0.5);// R=6,fi=1deg,Z=0.5
 //  coordinate transformation form cylindrical to magnetic coordinates
   Vector3d boozer = mConf.cyl2mag(cyl); // boozer is (s,theta,phi)
   Vector3d B = mConf.getBcyl(cyl);         // B-vector in cylindrical coord.

   double s = boozer[0];               // normalized toroidal flux
   double reff = mConf.r(s);           // effective r in [m]
 }
Todo:
add function void setWarningLevel(int level);
Examples:

1stexample.cpp, accuracytest.cpp, cpp2for.cpp, eeff_example.cpp, Fbs_example.cpp, Gv_example.cpp, and remesh.cpp.

enum fileFormat

Enumerator:
UNDEFINED  file-format types, for internal use

unknown file format

W7X_FMT  ascii W7X format(J.Geiger)
W7X_BIN4  4-byte(float) binary W7X format(Y.Turkin)
W7X_BIN8  8-byte(double) binary W7X format(Y.Turkin)
LHD  LHD format.
LHD1  LHD format.
VMEC  VMEC wout-format; use without transformation to Boozer coordinates.
VMECNETCDF  VMEC netCDF wout-format; use without transformation to Boozer coordinates.
W7X_DB  W7X format from database.
EFIT  G EQDSK File from EFIT.
W7X_FMT_TSFC  ascii W7X format(Y.Turkin) for Tokamak Symmetry Flux Coordinates
W7X_FMT_VMEC  ascii W7X format(Y.Turkin) for VMEC Coordinates
W7X_FMT_VMEC_FP  ascii W7X format(J.Geiger) for VMEC Coordinates after FP

virtual bool load ( const char *  filename  )  [virtual]

The method loads the magnetic configuration stored in the file filename.

The method recognizes the format of the file by analyzing its contents; bc-, bc-binary-, LHD- and VMEC(wout, version>=6.20)-format are supported. For bc-format please see W7-X format or ask J.Geiger. The binary-format file is produced by the CStconfig::write() method. Usually you may want to use this format for faster loading of the magnetic configuration; and probably you don't need to know the exact structure of the binary-format file.

Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is true; false otherwise. 
  #include "CStconfig.h"
  int main() {
    CStconfig mConf;
    mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bc");
    if(!mConf.isOK()) exit(1);   // exit if not OK
    if(!mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bin4")) exit(1); // exit if not OK
    if(!mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bin8")) exit(1); // exit if not OK
  }

Reimplemented in C3dMesh.

Examples:
1stexample.cpp, accuracytest.cpp, raytrace1.cpp, and remesh.cpp.

const char *  confname,
const char *  machine_name,
int  Nsmax,
bool  magAxis 
) const

The method inserts magnetic configuration Data into database.

Parameters:
mcdb -- address of the MCDB control structure, see MCDB documentation
confname -- configuration name.
machine_name -- machine name (for example W7-X).
Nsmax -- the number of flux surfaces to save or zero if original number of surfaces is needed to save.
magAxis -- if true then store magnetic axis.
Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is true; false otherwise.

bool write ( const char *  fname  )  const

Store current magnetic configuration into file.

The format of the file is derived from the file extension. The following file extention are possible:

  • bc -- write("w.bc"); //save into ascii file, see W7-X format
  • bin4 -- write("w.bin4"); //save into binary file using float numbers
  • bin8 -- write("w.bin8"); //save into binary file using double numbers
Parameters:
fname -- filename
Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is true; false otherwise.
Attention:
Current truncation level and value of magnetic field are used.

Referenced by MCwrite(), and MCWRITE().

bool writeasciiReduced ( const char *  fname,
int  nsmax = 0,
double  newVolume = 0,
double  newLastSurface = 1,
bool  varNumberMods = true,
bool  magAxis = false,
bool  circular = false,
bool  append = false 
) const

The methods transform the current magnetic configuration to new volume or to new mesh on s.

Parameters:
fname is the filename under which the configuration is saved.
nsmax is the number of surfaces to store, if zero then the original flux surfaces are stored, otherwise store the surfaces using a new mesh which is equidistant on sqrt(s).
newVolume is the new volume if not zero.
newLastSurface if not zero then this is the value of new last-closed-flux-surface in inits of current s, this parameter is used to reduce volume.
varNumberMods if true then variable number of harmonics for each flux surface are stored.
magAxis if true then store magnetic axis.
circular is applicable only for tokamak, if true then only cosine Fourier series for R coordinate and sine Fourier series for Z coordinate are stored.
append if true then append to the file fname .
Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is true; false otherwise.
Attention:
Current truncation level and value of magnetic field are used;
Examples:
remesh.cpp.

Referenced by MCSAVEREDUCED(), and MCsetLCMS().

double truncate ( double  level  ) 

Set truncation level to reduce number of harmonics used in summation.

For each flux surface this method calculates M and N such that Bmn/B00 > level for m<M and |n|<N. Then only harmonics with m<M and |n|<N are used in summation.

Parameters:
level is the new truncation level. The method returns the value of the old truncation level
Examples:
1stexample.cpp, 2ndexample.cpp, accuracytest.cpp, eeff_example.cpp, Fbs_example.cpp, Gv_example.cpp, raytrace1.cpp, and remesh.cpp.

Referenced by MCSAVEREDUCED(), MCtruncate(), and MCTRUNCATE().

double truncate (  )  const

The method returns the current value of truncation level.

double epsEffGraz ( double  s  ) 

The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport, using Graz definition of the minor radius dr=ds/<|grad(s)|>, where s is the normalized toroidal flux.

Parameters:
s is the normalized toroidal flux
See also:
V.V.Nemov, S.V.Kasilov, W. Kernbichler, and M.F.Heyn, Physics of Plasmas, vol. 6, 4622(1999), http://link.aip.org/link/PHPAEN/v6/i12/p4622/s1

28th EPS, http://epsppd.epfl.ch/Madeira/html/pdf/P5.055.pdf , EGA Vol.25A (2001) 1985-1988

Note:
At first call the method creates a look-up table using multithreading technique to spread callculation among several CPU cores; this table is used for interpolating over the flux surface label.
Use the following methods to set parameters: epsEffSetXeffParam(), epsEffSetTracingParam(), epsEffSetIotaParam(), epsEffSetMagnMomentParam()

Referenced by MCGETEPSEFF().

double epsEffVmec ( double  s  ) 

The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport, using VMEC definition of minor radius r=a*sqrt(s), where s is the normalized toroidal flux.

epsEffVmec^1.5 = epsEffGraz^1.5 * <|grad(s)|>^2 * (r/(2s))^2

Parameters:
s is the normalized toroidal flux.
See also:
V.V.Nemov, S.V.Kasilov, W. Kernbichler, and M.F.Heyn, Physics of Plasmas, vol. 6, 4622(1999), http://link.aip.org/link/PHPAEN/v6/i12/p4622/s1

dphi is the toroidal step in radians for fild line integration (default value is 0.4 degree)
iotaDenominator if not zero then this number is the denominator in iota aproximation by rational number.
Returns:
std::vector with the parallel adiabatic invariant J , partial derivative dJ/ds , partial derivative dJ/dalpha (alpha=theta/iota - phi) with the bounce time in the fourth element, in the fifth element
See also:

Vector3d getMagCoordAtB ( const Vector3d &  mag,
double  Bt 
)

The method returns the magnetic coordinates of the point (that belongs to the given field line) at which the magnetic field is equal to the given value.

Parameters:
mag defines the field line;
Bt is the magnetic field value, must be within the interval Bmin..Bmax for the considered field line;
Returns:
Vector3d with the magnetic coordinates at which the magnetic field value is Bt or Vector3d with (-1,Bmin,Bmax) if Bt is not within the interval Bmin..Bmax;
Note:
the method seaches the point of interest starting from the point where B=Bmin, Bmin is seached within one machine period: 0<=phi<2*pi/Np
See also:
Jinvariant(), Bmin(double s), Bmax(double s)

Vector3d* SMatrix ( double  s,
int  npol = 180,
int  ntor = 200 
)

The method calculates the Susceptance matrix in (Flux,theta,phi)-coordinates.

See definition of the Susceptance matrix in P.I.Strand,W.A.Houlberg, Physics of Plasmas, 8, 2782(2001)

Parameters:
s is the normalized toroidal flux, s = Flux/Flux_max
npol specifies the number of points for poloidal integration.
ntor specifies the number of points for toroidal integration.
Returns:
Susceptance matrix Sij, see example: 
 #include "CStconfig.h"
 int main() {
   CStconfig mConf;
   if(!mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bc")) exit(1);
   Vector3d *S = mConf.SMatrix(0.5,200,200);
   double S12 =  S[1][2];
 }
Note:
The Susceptance matrix in (s,theta,phi)-coordinates can be expressed through relation S_ij(Flux,theta,phi)=S_ij(s,theta,phi)* dFlux/ds

The method is obsolete, use it for testing only. See S11(), S12(), S21(), S22() for faster and better alternative.

Vector3d curvatureAvrg ( double  s,
int  nth = 120,
int  nph = 120 
)

The method calculates the flux average of normal and geodesic curvatures.

   CStconfig mConf;
   if(!mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bc")) exit(1);
   Vector3d k = mConf.curvatureAvrg(0.5,200,200);
   double kN =  k[0];
   double kG =  k[1];
 }

double pavrg ( double  s,
double  x 
) const

The method returns the <p> -- flux average of pitch angle on the surface s.

The method returns the value of function P(s,x) = <sqrt(1-x*B(s,th,ph)/Bmax(s))>, where 0<=x<=1, 0<=s<=1, and definition of x is the following x=(1-p^2)/b, p is the pitch angle, b=B(s,th,ph)/Bmax(s).

Referenced by MCPAVRG().

double integralInvPavrg ( double  s,
double  x 
) const

The method returns the Integral(from x to 1) dx'/P(s,x') on the surface s.

The method returns the Integral(from x to 1) dx'/P(s,x'), where P(s,x) = <sqrt(1-x*B(s,th,ph)/Bmax(s))>,

Referenced by MCINTINVPAVRG().

void useMixedProductForJacobian ( bool  sw  ) 

If sw==true then the method forces to use Jacobian=dX/dFlux*(dX/dtheta^dX/dphi) for calculating B field.

Referenced by MCuseMixedProductForJacobian(), and MCUSEMIXEDPRODUCTFORJACOBIAN().

double Jacobian ( const Vector3d &  magCoord,
double *  Bmod = 0 
) const

Jacobian: dV = Jacobian(s,theta,phi)*ds*dtheta*dphi.

Parameters:
magCoord is the vector with magnetic coordinates (s,theta,phi).
Returns:
the value of Jacobian at the point (s,theta,phi)
Parameters:
[out] *Bmod is the B(s,theta,phi) if Bmod is not NULL
Note:
Jacobian in coordinates (s,theta,phi)
Boozer Jacobian = FluxTor'*mu0*(Ip*Np+iota*It)/B^2/twopi^2)
Tokamak Jacobian = FluxTor'*R*R/(mu0*Ipol)
Vmec Jacobian = Sum gmn*cos(....)
Jacobian has sign

Vector3d* NJacobian ( const Vector3d &  magCoord  ) 

The method calculates Jacobian matrix for Newton's iteration.

Parameters:
magCoord is the vector with magnetic coordinates (s,theta,phi).
Returns:
pointer to the array J of 4 vectors calculated in the point magCoord 
   (R )(Rs )(Rt )(Rp )           (R )       (Rs )
J= (fi)(fis)(fit)(fip), i.e J[0]=(fi), J[1]=(fis), ...
   (Z )(Zs )(Zt )(Zp )           (Z )       (Zs )
  where (R,fi,Z) is the corresponding point
  in cylindrical coordinates;
  Rs  = dR/ds,  Rt  = dR/dtheta,  Rp  = dR/dphi;
  fis = dfi/ds, fit = dfi/dtheta, fip = dfi/dphi;
Note:
Along with the Jacobian matrix calculation the method calculates other quantities, which are available through methods: getmodB(), getJac(), getJac2(), getJ(), getJ2(), getBxyz(), getBcyl(), getGradFlux(), getGrads(), getGradreff(),getMetricTensor().

Referenced by MCGETBCYL().

Vector3d* NJacobianL ( const Vector3d &  magCoord  ) 

The method calculates Jacobian matrix for Newton's iteration using linear interpolation on s.

see CStconfig::NJacobian

Note:
Don't use this method, it is needed only for testing.

Vector3d cyl2mag ( const Vector3d &  cyl  ) 

The method makes transformation from cylindrical to magnetic coordinates.

The method uses Newton's iteration to find magnetic coordinates, the guess value is estimated by CStconfig::cyl2guess or is taken from previous call.

Parameters:
cyl is the cylindrical coordinates
Returns:
magnetic coordinates.
Note:
After calling this function the other quantities are available through methods: getmodB(), getJac(), getJac2(), getJ(), getJ2(), getBxyz(), getBcyl(), getGradPsi(), getGrads(), getGradreff().
Examples:
2ndexample.cpp, and accuracytest.cpp.

Referenced by CStconfig::cyl2s(), MCCYL2MAG(), and MCCYL2MAG2().

Vector3d cyl2mag ( const Vector3d &  cyl,
const Vector3d &  magCoordGuess 
)

The method makes transformation from cylindrical to magnetic coordinates using guess value.

Parameters:
cyl is the cylindrical coordinates
magCoordGuess is the guess value
Returns:
magnetic coordinates.
Note:
After calling this function the other quantities are available through methods: getmodB(), getJac(), getJac2(), getJ(), getJ2(), getBxyz(), getBcyl(), getGradPsi(), getGrads(), getGradreff().

This method is obsolete, use cyl2mag(const Vector3d &cyl)

Vector3d cyl2guess ( const Vector3d &  cyl,
double  eps,
double  smax = 1,
bool *  inside = 0 
)

The method makes transformation from cylindrical to magnetic coordinates using 2d-iteration on R-Z plane.

The algorithm is robust and rather fast, use it for getting the guess value for the Newton method implemented in cyl2mag().

Parameters:
[in] cyl is the cylindrical coordinates
[in] eps is the relative accuracy of the transformation, use eps ~ 0.06 (for W7-X plasma, 0.06 is 3cm/50cm ) if you need only guess for Newton method, use eps ~ 0.001 if you need exact coordinate transformation.
[in] smax is the value of the 'extra' surface beyond LCMS, use smax <= 1.2
[out] inside is the address of the flag that is true if cyl is inside smax.
Returns:
magnetic coordinates.
Note:
the quantities getmodB(), getJac(), getJac2(), getJ(), getJ2(), getBxyz(), getBcyl(), getGradPsi(), getGrads(), getGradreff() are not available after calling this function. Call NJacobian() in oder to calculate these quantities.

const Vector3d* getMetricTensor (  ) 

The method retuns pointer to the MetricTensor calculated by CStconfig::NJacobian.

This tensor is for coordinates(s,theta,phi) and calculated also during coordinate transformation inside following functions: cyl2mag(),xyz2mag(),cyl2s(),xyz2s().

See also:
CStconfig::NJacobian
Returns:
metric tensor gij, where i=(0,1,2)=(s,theta,phi) see example: 
 #include "CStconfig.h"
 int main() {
   CStconfig mConf;
   if(!mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bc")) exit(1);
   Vector3d magCoord(0.5,1.,2.); // magnetic coordinates
   mConf.NJacobian(magCoord);
   Vector3d *g = mConf.getMetricTensor();
   double g12 =  g[1][2];  // g_theta,phi
 }

const Vector3d* getMetricTensor ( const Vector3d &  cyl  ) 

The method returns pointer to the metricTensor calculated in the point cyl.

Returns:
metric tensor gij, where i=(0,1,2)=(s,theta,phi) see example: 
 #include "CStconfig.h"
 int main() {
   CStconfig mConf;
   if(!mConf.load("w7x-sc1.bc")) exit(1);
   Vector3d cyl(5.5,2.,0.5); // cylindrical coordinates
   Vector3d *g = mConf.getMetricTensor(cyl);
   double g12 =  g[1][2];    // g_theta,phi
 }

bool writeVmec2Boozer ( const char *  fname,
int  method = 0,
int  M = 0,
int  N = 0 
)

The method transforms the VMEC wout-file to Boozer-coordinate data file.

Parameters:
fname is the filename under which the configuration is saved.
method if 0 then Boozer spectrum are obtained by integrating over Boozer angles, otherwise the integrations over VMEC angles are performed; the method 0 is faster, because summation (numerical integration) is performed using FFT;
M is the number of poloidal mods, if M==0 then the number of Fourier mods is three times of that of VMEC expansion;
N is the number of toroidal mods, if M==0 then the number of Fourier mods is three times of that of VMEC expansion:
Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is true; false otherwise. 
 #include "CStconfig.h"
 int main() {
   MConf::CStconfig mConf;
   if(!mConf.load("wout.w7x-sc1.txt")) exit(1);
   mConf.writeVmec2Boozer("w7x-sc1.bc");
 }
See also:
Transformation from VMEC to Boozer Coordinates

double Vmec2BoozerTest ( const Vector3d &  vmecCoord  ) 

The method peforms test, that d(theta_booz,phi_booz)/d(theta_vmec,phi_vmec) == (Jacobian_vmec/Jacobian_booz).

Parameters:
vmecCoord is the VMEC coordinates (s,theta_v,phi_v)
Returns:
ratio { d(theta_booz,phi_booz)/d(theta_vmec,phi_vmec) } / (Jacobian_vmec/Jacobian_booz)

bool getRayEntryPoint ( const Vector3d &  r0,
const Vector3d &  rd,
Vector3d &  entryPoint 
)

The method traces the Last Closed Magnetic Surface (LCMS).

The method finds the first intersection of the ray with the LCMS, where the ray is R(t)=r0+rd*t, and t>=0.

Parameters:
r0 is the Cartesian coordinates of the ray origin, must be outside with respect to the LCMS,
rd is the direction of the ray in Cartesian coordinates,
entryPoint this vector at return contains the Cartesian coordinates of the ray entry point into the plasma,
Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is true; false otherwise.

bool getRayIntersectionPoints ( const Vector3d &  r0,
const Vector3d &  rd,
Vector3d &  entryPoint,
Vector3d &  exitPoint 
)

The method traces the Last Closed Magnetic Surface (LCMS).

The method finds intersections of the ray with the LCMS, where the ray is R(t)=r0+rd*t, and t>=0.

Parameters:
r0 is the Cartesian coordinates of the ray origin, must be outside with respect to the LCMS,
rd is the direction of the ray in Cartesian coordinates,
entryPoint this vector at return contains the Cartesian coordinates of the ray entry point into the plasma,

int getJacobianSign (  ) 

The method returns the sign of the Jacobian calculating the mixed product dX/ds*(dX/dtheta^dX/dphi).

Where ^ is a cross product signs,and the (s,theta,phi) are the magnetic coordinates: (flux label, poloidal, and toroidal angles); X is the cartesian vector.

int getThetaDirection (  ) 

The method returns the direction of the poloidal angle.

Plus sign corresponds to counterclockwise direction on the R-Z plane when looking on it in fi-direction,where fi is the cylindrical angle. Plus sign also means that increasing theta increases angle = atan((Z(theta)-Zaxis)/(R(theta)-Raxis)).

int getPhiDirection (  ) 

The method returns the direction of the toroidal angle.

Plus sign corresponds to the direction on the cylindrical angle.

int getSignOfCurrentThatIncreasesAbsIota (  )  const

The method returns the direction of the toroidal current j^phi (in the right-handed cylindrical coordinates system), that increases the absolute value of the iota.

Returns:
1 or -1 depending on the direction of the toroidal current.
